review_title: Great game, very realistic it's scary!
one_reviews_text: At first it wouldn't load, but the devs responded right away and not only fixed this game, other games that weren't working are now working too. This one is amazing, closest thing to a fight. the opponent is RIGHT There in front of you. As mike tyson said, everyone has a plan until they get punched in the face. You get that same experience here. And it's a work out, I didn't expect that, had to rest this dad bod after two rounds.
review_feedback: Hey islandberserker, Sorry to hear you're still unable to successfully launch Creed. Whenever you get a chance, could you contact our customer support team at support@survios.com so we could help troubleshoot this issue with? Apologies again for this inconvenience!

one_reviews_text:
I was having the same problem of the game refusing to launch on my new alienware PC. Tried verifying files, rebooting, reinstalling, nothing was working until I followed these steps that apparently bypassed some known bug in the code for my intel processor:

Right click on "My computer" then properties

Then right hand side "advanced system settings"

On the Advanced tab choose Environment Variables

In THE SECOND window click NEW

Enter name

OPENSSL_ia32cap

Enter value

~0x200000200000000

Then click OK

1 last important step

REBOOT SYSTEM

After that it worked, looks, and feels GREAT!!!
No more launching problems AT ALL!

We have 23 pcs and the licened version of creed. The game will only launch on the 5 of them i personally built!! Neither the steam version or the Oculus version will launch. Ive done all updates for Bios, drivers and windows 11! i also rolled back windows 11 to windows 10, complety wiped the hard drivers and ran a fresh install to no avail. Lastly, Ive recently purchased a MSI Trident with a 3090, I9 cpu, 32 gb of ram, 10 TB of starage and a fresh copy of Windows 11 and nothing. There absoulty no answers on the internet. PLEASE HELP !!!!!! WHO CAN I CALL OR EMAIL FOR A TROUBLE SHOOTING SOLUTION??

Thank You

review_title: This is a good action game buy it
one_reviews_text:
I uppercutted my dog doing this so it's a 10/10 
Also,stop comparing this game/saying buy thrill of fight and if the people who dont know thrill of fight its a game where you dont have stamina but have garbo graphics, Although I would say this game is 20 dollars and not 30, I saw a review saying "In conclusion its not a bad game in itself, its just there is a "superior version called thrill of fight" It isn't superior at all. I recommend buying this game instead of buying thrill of fight

For this review I will be comparing it to "thrill of the fight"

Advantages over "ToTF"
- Multiplayer
- Cool Enemy fighters 
- Not much else

Cons 
- Hands dont move as fast as your hands in real life
- punches dont connect 
- arcadey feel 
- wierd movement controlls
- Limited to the games stamina bar 
- Multiplayer doesnt even work when trying to play friends

In conclusion its not a bad game in itself, its just there is a superior version called Thrill of the fight which
- Lets you play until you personally cant move or youll vomit
- Normal movement
- Punches dont lag behind and they fell impactful and weighted
- Punches connect
- Your enemy takes advantage of you letting your gaurd down
- good adjustable settings
- Fun events
Use this game for exercise its quite good, but could do with a reset view button as i often end up 180 Deg

review_title: Best VR game in my opinion
one_reviews_text: Creed = BEst

This is nothing like boxing. Power behind punch doesn't count. Defense doesn't work at all, you have a fake stamina meaning you can only punch as much as the game wants you to.  Ennemies in Champion difficulty drop you with 20 hits when you need to land more than 200 to even hope to defeat them, well, not all of them, the last tier is tough the rest just drop like flies even in Champion.

Very disapointing. Moved on to another boxing game.

review_title: An excellent game, except for stamina
one_reviews_text:
This game is one of the best VR games I've ever played. Everytime I get into the game I always have fun. But, at the same time, the game has a stamina system. This system limits the amount of punches you can throw before having to hunker down for 2-4 seconds. It is honestly one of the dumbest mechanics I have found in a VR game. This game is a boxing game, yet limits the amount of punches you can throw. WHY? The game wouldn't need to be changed at all if you removed the mechanic, that's how little it matters. All it does is slow down fights and get you knocked out in others if you're going for a knockout and suddenly it's like your slapping the person with a tissue. 

TLDR: This game would be 5 stars if they didn't put a pointless stamina system in the game the slows down fights and limits the player's own ability. If you want a game that is just as fun with much more realism, play Thrill of The Fight (which is also cheaper).

review_title: I Would Recommend it, but Fix These!!!!!
one_reviews_text: The only things I think should be added is more realism to the characters and we don't need our character to get tired, because eventually we will get tired, so we don't need the character we play as getting tired, and make the PvP blocking work better, but other than that the game is great and is good for exercise.

This game is great. Best boxing game in my opinion. Would be better if you could play cross platform at least with all oculus devices like the rift with a quest. Also if you could keep a record of your online fights that would be sweet.
Fun concept, well executed, and is certainly a good workout. Overall I really liked this game. Highly recommended if you want an entertaining, immersive boxing experience.

The phantom fighting in this game is clean, when you dodge and weave you can dash towards your opponent with swift strikes knocking them out. This is a MUST HAVE!

Pros: Great experience. Immerive and fun fight simulation.  Interacting with characters from the movie was pretty cool.  You actually get a pretty good cardio workout by boxing a few rounds.
Cons: However, it's like the developers felt they sould just submit their half finished homework. There's a side story with one chapter that never goes anywhere. The career plot is fun, but fighting is pretty easy even in intermediate mode (and I am no pro boxer!). And then the game is over before you know it. If you want to have some fun, you can sit in the ring waiting for someone to challenge you PvP. I still haven't gotten anyone to actually join me in a fight. Game kind of becomes pointless after you do the career once or twice. I expect more for my money!

The game is great and also needs improvment. starting with that i beat the champaign really fast on easy and medium, so expand it please. also there needs to be more characters to the game. Also rookie is way too easy which is good for beginers but pro is also kinda easy but champion is near impossible because i get hit 15 times and im tko'd. and finally again like the title, it is really fun at first for people starting vr for first time and not soo much when your experienced and when you play for a day or two it gets boring. so please read this and add to your game please

review_title: I dig it, but could be better.
one_reviews_text: I can fight Ivan, Apollo, and Clubber, I mean come on Im in.  I think the game needs more adustability as your fitness progresses to keep it challenging. Some new fighters added to keep the career path interesting. I finally had a chance to PVP, but found it much more clunky than the single player game.  Overall I will keep playing this eperience but I could see a time if its not refreshed moving on to the "next".

I enjoyed this game alot. Visually it is great. The training mode really is challenging. However the game it self, is really just some arcade game, that doesn't really take your own skills in to consideration. Your stamina, strenght, etc. is determened by the boxer you chose. So even if you could go on for hours, your boxer is fatigued. Or even if you are weak, your boxer hits heavy etc.

The fights are over very quickly and the story mode is very short. Also it is disapointing, that you can't create your own fighter (sure, you follow the rocky story... but still).

There are other, more realistic boxing games out there. I switched to another game, which is more like a simulation than a game.

Before I talk about owning this on the PSVR before repurchasing on the Quest/Riff I’m gonna explain something.

There’s a very simple method is not only for easy mobility but it will also increase your fighting capabilities in PVP. First TURN ADVANCE LOCOMOTION OFF!!! Its unnecessary. Now the game explains to swing your arms but there’s an easier way, if you hold both of the move buttons down with the gloves to your face soon as you move your hands or sway, your whole body will follow. If you hold the buttons down and kinda may a Skii motion forward or backwards you will shoot in that direction depending on how hard you swing. If you toy around with this you will learn even more advance tricks, like shooting directly behind your opponent, press the B button and automatically face them, most people can’t react fast enough or don’t know how to automatically face their opponent, so you can get some great shots in. Works very well in SinglePlayer making you feel like DBZ seeing them in slow motion while you’re just planning which angle you should launch your next attack. 

Now of course the stamina thing can be an issue but you won’t ever fall into that situation if you just pick your shots, also I think they included this mechanics because certain fighter have stat buffs in certain punches, so to spam shots could be kinda cheating, would be nice if they had a mode where all the boxers are at an even level.

With that being said I am looking forward to Survios next project, these fighting mechanics is what I wanted from a boxer. I played Thrill of The Fight but I think VRFighting Champions has better mechanics than that game but Creed has much better mechanics than both previous mentioned games imo. 5/5

one_reviews_text:

I really like this game. Its a great workout and feels realistic to play. My only gripe is the bots seem indestructable and able to knock you out through your defence. I have repeately done 3 or 4 punch combos which would knock a real persons head off and the bot acts like I hit them with a feather duster. Then They'll immediately punch through my defence and knock me out. At this point I'm looking to use the game for fitness rather than boxing practice.

One of my biggest complaint is that the "drill" easily start distributing exercises outside of the room boundary. This means you end up losing exercises because it puts a punching bag inside the walls of your house, which obviously you can't reach.

A bit more effort could be put to avoid placing the user in exercise directions that the game knows will be problematic. Favor placing the player in front of two cameras so that his/her hands won't be obstructed by the body. In drill exercise mode, you can place the exercise anywhere, so favor a direction with better tracking.

The story mode is great, but too short. I hope it gets developped a lot more. Would love to see 30+ unique characters.

To people who are complaining about the stamina system: you are punching in the air without hitting anyone. I find this mechanic works, seems like people would appreciate the option to turn it off either way.

For a fuller experience, learn a thing or two from Knockout League, their punching bag exercise is really fun and they have a great character building aspect, even if more cartoonish.

Maybe a type of stamina mixed drill that does not stop would be a good adition.

Overall this game is a great accomplishment, with a few acute flaws.
The punching mechanics are really weird and really ruin the game

i was sore the day after i played this and had to stop a few times to wipe the sweat out of the headset ... so much fun and really cool to play a game that gets you really moving ... youll love this game especially putting your new to vr friends in it haha

review_title: Great for fun and for working out
one_reviews_text:
I would have given this game a higher star rating if it weren't for the stamina system. When your fighter is low on stamina, they either cannot throw punches or the punches are extremely slow.

It kind of ruins the immersion because you are more focused on your gloves flashing more than defending your opponent at times. If your opponent blocks one of your punches, you all of the sudden have no stamina. That is kind of ridiculous.

I think the devs should really evaluate the stamina situation, especially when it comes to PVP. Maybe make the stamina more costly in later rounds... or make body shots reduce the opponent's stamina... anything but the way it is now.

Aside from those issues, the game offers plenty of content. When I don't feel like going to the gym in real life, I will throw Creed on and try to get some high scores in the gym, or take on the AI in some 1 v 1 fights. PVP can be really fun too if both players have a good connection.

Overall, this game is definitely worth it.

the graphics are great, the boxing rings are nice too. with that said thats the only thing I like about this game. The locomotion is designed pretty bad and it doesnt feel 1:1 roomscale. Theres another game I bought same time as this that handles movement (punching and moving) much better than this game. I prefer gameplay over pretty looks.

I play this game (Online PVP) pretty much everyday and I love it. Yes the pvp can get spammy but it's not hard to block the spam. All you have to do is BLOCK it's very easy to the point when I face spammers they arent hard to beat at all I recommed this game to any and everyone, it's probably my favorite VR game ever so please buy it so I can face you in online PVP!

The look and feel are just about perfect but they made some silly design choices that just ruin the experience. When you get stunned you go out of body and have to match your real hands to your VR hands. When you get knocked out you go way out of your body and have to run back to it. It is the dumbest thing I have ever seen and kills all immersion. The simulated fatigue by making your punches useless if you punch too much just doesn't work and despite all the people complaining about it the developers stand behind it. The biggest weakness of the game is that it seems to only register a punch as hard or soft, regardless of how hard or soft you actually threw it. The result is very little incentive to actually try to throw a hard punch... as long as its just hard enough to qualify as a power punch. Even worse is that you frequently receive accidental knockouts when you barely touched them. More than once I have accidentally knocked someone out while trying to just adjust my headset. Ultimately my biggest complaint about the game is that is penalizes you for trying to play realistically and that just defeats the point. Thrill of the Fight is infinitely better in every regard it just lacks the look and polish that you get from a major studio production. As a die hard boxing fan it is a no brainer for me, there is no reason to play this over Thrill of the Fight.
you won't belive how great this game is until you play it but creators please make the career longer but other that that great game

Who doesn't like a bit of a punch up? This is a great game for a bit of exercise and genuine fun. Hope the developers keep fine tuning - especially the online
PVP mode.  Its not a 100% realistic obviously but still gives plenty of satisfaction

review_feedback: Hey kmm764, To make CREED: Rise to Glory perform to our standards on Quest, we had to significantly rework the game's code and art assets. Unfortunately, for there to be cross-play between the Quest and PC versions of Creed, the code and assets need to be nearly identical. This was not possible due to the amount of optimization required to make Creed successfully perform on Quest.

review_title: great at first, shame on length
one_reviews_text: I have wanted this for some time, but only made the leap when it was on sale. I must say my first experience was that this game is awesome. Top quality VR game. It really is very impressive. I can see people writing reviews after 15mins saying how it is the best thing ever. I was tempted too do so myself. Other people have eluded to the length of the career mode and I was shocked when my final fight happened. I thought, nah seriously that can't be it and waited to carry on, but that was it. Could have been so much more! The devs have done all the hard stuff and made this a brilliant piece of work. The easy bit is surely just to make it a bit longer and build the story a bit better. Very frustrating. Could easly have got 6 stars from me if that was possible :) but can only give it 4. I felt 3 was unfair because this is a high quality game and not like the usual standard that get churned out for VR. Definite buy on sale. I would happily pay full price for a more in depth solo career.

While fighting against A.I your punches are quick and fluid. However while fighting in PVP your movement becomes slow. I'm guessing this is because of varying internet speeds between the two fighters and they find suitable equal speed to apply to both. Due to this you rarely find anyone to fight against in PVP and when you do finally find someone your reflexes are very slow and you can lose to someone even though you have more experience.

review_title: A lot less tracking issues than Quest
one_reviews_text: Playing this on Rift S, I don't have many tracking issues in comparison with the Quest. Great game on both, but hoping they continue to improve the Quest version

Really nice game that will make you workout and keep on playing. I dont like the movement during the match and I cant seem to hit any uppercuts, dont know if it is only me. or something within the game itself..?

This is the first game (VR or otherwise) I've "completed", beaten everything on the hardest modes (with the weakest fighter!), got all the achievements, everything.  It is so much fun and also a great workout.  Just the "feel" of the boxing overall is fantastic.  This would be 5+ stars from me, if it wasn't for 2 major issues that go together to bring down the experience. 

1st, the multiplayer is essentially completely broken.  Movement and hit detection are all over the place.  I thought maybe it was because I was playing people far away or with bad internet or bad PC's, but I have 2 VR setups on very high-end PC's with fiber internet.  Got 2 copies of the game to try out multiplayer, and nope, still incredibly buggy.  I don't know if this is a coding issue or just the fact that such fast and constant motions that require perfect hit detection cannot work over the internet in any game, period.  Anyway, bottom line is the multiplayer doesn't work.

2nd while the single player is extremely fun, if you are in good physical condition and have good reflexes/reactions, then it isn't particularly challenging.  Setting the game to the hardest difficulty increases the challenge but only in a 100% purely artificial way.  The opponents don't get any "better" they just take 200+ hits to take out, while your character can get knocked down from a single hit, or taken out of the match entirely in less than 20 jabs (not even powerful punches).  The multiplayer would have provided endless challenge, but that's broken.

So all things considered it is a very fun game and I can still recommend it, but depending on your physical condition don't expect to get more than a few hours out of this before the challenge is gone.  Maybe 10 hours if you are ok with the purely artificial difficulty.

Hatte erst Probleme beim installieren, jetzt hat es geklappt und der erste Eindruck ist sehr positiv. Wer Download Probleme hat einfach paar Stunden später nochmal probieren. Bin froh das sich das Problem erledigt hat.

This game is very good. I love this game, but after two days of downloading the game, I can't load into it. In the oculus app, I click on it, it says now playing and shows it booting up, but then it automatically clicks out of the game back to the oculus app. I tried restarting the app, and the computer, I even tried uninstalling the game, but it didn't work. Please fix this issue.
review_feedback: Hey jcd62471, sorry to hear you're experiencing this issue with Creed. Could you please contact us at support@survios.com so we can help troubleshoot this issue with you? Thank you for your patience!

one_reviews_text: Very fun game with top notch graphics and production values. Decent, albeit arcadey boxing mechanics. This game is designed to be a fun arcade style experience not a boxing simulator. Some have complained about the artificial stamina which requires you to put up your guard to regain stamina. I thought this was a great idea since it forces you to pace yourself which a real boxer has to do. If you want to really test your stamina try Thrill Of The Fight which I guarantee will wear you out since there is no artificial stamina and so you can fight as hard as you are capable. The training exercises are fun and actually relevant to the fights since the better you do in training the more stamina your character has in his next fight. I just wish the career mode was longer with more story elements. Great job devs!

This is a very good boxing game with superb blocking and dodging mechanics, but when it comes down to the relatively small amount of people to box with. I personally beat everyone on Championship difficulty and gained every achievement within the game and ran out of things to do. Another thing to note is that within my times during pvp mode (player versus player) several people were exploiting a glitch which was literally game breaking. It pretty much was karate chopping where they repeated the same exact movement over and over again. (Holding up guard but constantly chopping back and forth with both hands.)

Clearly one of the best VR games ever made.  Besides having the best graphics possible, a high budget theme, and excellent mechanics, you can get creative by doing things such as jogging around the gym, mock lifting weights and engaging in a full body work out.  For first time VR players I must caution becoming too engaged in the game, because I have seen more than one person become fatigued to the point of exhaustion, and almost passing out.  I can not say enough about this game, except that it is a must have.

review_title: This is what you're looking for
one_reviews_text: If you're tired of looking for a new vr game that's actually fun and addicting, then this is it. Also an AWESOME workout
Makes you feel like a super start boxer.

I've noticed that on Champion mode, during freeplay on the new characters (in particular James Lang), the AI can hit you without actually throwing a punch, which is kind of silly.  The AI doesn't really seem to speed up or throw more punches (although, they do have more 'health'), instead, occasionally, they crowd you, then 'punch' you without actually throwing a punch, sending you immediately into either flurry or knockdown mode.

Additionally, the glint system is completely broken (on all difficulties) as the AI will sometimes 'glint' a hard hit, only to then decide not to throw that punch and throw a different punch instead, making the glints completely useless at best and deceptive at worst.
I tried uninstalling and reinstalling but it just fails before it launches.  Please advise.
review_feedback: Hey biver0, sorry to hear you're experiencing this issue with Creed as well. Could you please contact us at support@survios.com so we can help troubleshoot this issue with you? Thank you for your patience!

one_reviews_text: This is my favorite boxing game. I have played through the story mode like 4 times. My only suggestion is to add more to the story mode

review_title: Decent boxer with little staying power
one_reviews_text:
What is here is done as well as it probably could be. However, the content is extremely short and I found little reason to keep repeating matches unless you are an avid fan of the movie.

It gets your heart pumping for sure. Simply punching air with the controllers in hand is a pretty good workout, gets me sweating in a few matches. The training workouts are rather dull and useless for me, unless you are role playing the movie. Punches seem to be tracked pretty well and getting a solid hit really feels good. I like the theme music.

Unfortunately, it pretty much ends there.  Firstly, the fighters are really bad, it seemed the only challenge came from them getting up more in the later fights so you would get tired. I found myself hating the stamina mechanic because it would say I'm tired when I myself could keep throwing punches just fine. Even worse, your AI opponents seem to have unlimited stamina. The stamina game is there make you stop and guard to recover, in my opinion, an attempt by developer to make fights artifcially longer. 

The location tracking could be better, I would have liked to have more of my movement in my room tracked instead of standing in one spot for the entire round.  In order to move you have to put your guard down and fake walk with your hands. This is a serious conflict in controls and makes you simply stand firm rather than risk trying to move. Why not just use the control sticks? The menus are too deep, you have to go through several useless menus to get to a fight, which is the only real point to the game. There's also no "quit" button. It's minor but really bugs me that I have to quit the app from oculus dashboard rather than have an in-game button on one of their many useless menus.

I would like to see them drop the "training montage" and just let you walk around the gym and do whatever you want when you want. Just leave it open for me to use like my own virtual gym. Fighter AI could be vastly improved as well.

Completed easiest career mode and 2 fights in freemode, one of which I lost. I got a heck of a workout. Sweat a lot and lost my breath a few times (since I'm a smoker). I knew I was going to throw punches in the air but the game pushed me a bit more than that. I recommend this game for potato couch dwellers like me. It's nice to get motivated by a game to exert oneself in a fun way.

+Highly physical: You need to punch hard to do more damage. 
+Great Graphics: The graphics are top notch. Stadiums are very well done and the boxer details are amazing. Crowd is ok but could have use more dynamic animations. 
+Great music: That music puts you really into the moment. Movie-like soundtrack. I love it. 
+Innovative game mechanics: The in-game stamina is intuitive. And i love it. That forces you to recover while blocking, so you gotta be smart when you throw hard punches. 
+Campaign and training are cool additions
+Multiplayer works very well. Not enough players online (so forget about the matchmaking) but i mean if you have a friend to play with easily then you will love it. 

- Campaign is too short. There should have been a huge ladder where you strategically try to make your way up and challenge higher and higher ranked boxers. As you would progress, you get more points to distribute in in-game attributes (recovery, fatigue, strenght, etc.) that allows you to challenge higher ranked boxers.

review_title: Big hollywood that is not a flop
one_reviews_text: Jesus Christ is mankinds sole hope!

I KO'd my laptop with a left hook to the body!  Split my thumb wide open boss!  I would say it is more important to clear your play area than in other games lol!  Kinda caused a lot of damage to the laptop wow and then lost the fight.  I guess I can't pause?  Dunno I'll hafta find out.  I am not sure but I am guessing that I will build strenght and stamina with the toon by exercising?  Not really understanding why my arm is seperate from my toons arm in the form of a blue ghost, cause I am tired?  Really like it so far that being said I have really only exercised a little doing each station 2 or 3 times also a montage after the first bout.  Had 3 freestyle bouts 2 with the mexican and one with the black fella all on default difficulty won all 3 not counting the bout I trashed my laptop.  Having a little difficulty figuring out how to block I am begining to think that maybe I can only dodge.  Get a solid 4 stars from me so far I will see if it will hold up over time.
Great game but wheres the legends update?

This is a great game, I think some people dont really understand the reason for the stamina mechanic saying they rather tire themselves out but thats not the point of it. I do agree they should include more custom match rules that let you remove stamina or stagger mechanics. I also wish they would fix this friends list thing I cant add anyone. The real problem I have is that PvP matches are hard to get sometimes, I wait like 10 minutes once and no match and I know its not cos no one is around cos that was the time I was actually trying to duel my friend and we would hit the search pvp button at the same time and still would take for ever.... so yea fix pvp match making I'd like to be able to keep challenging people without having to wait for someone to connect with me 20 minutes at a time.  All that aside this game is awesome it can only get better if the dev's really want it to..

Amazing Game had so much fun on it the only down side is I cannot seem to find a multiplayer lobby after searching for a long time so I would love to make some new friends to play against in this game

I highly recomend this game.  You get a great workout and have so much fun too! I think it may just be a little bit on the easy side, as I haven't played for long and I have won the championship in Pro mode, and will now run through on the hardest mode.  I would also like to see if new characters can be unlocked, I thought completing the career mode would do this, but it doesn't seem to have.  Keep it up devs, please keep developing for this.  PVP can also be fantastic and improve the challenge by playing a smarter human.
Love this game
This is the perfect example of a VR game, Its like being inside "Punch Out"
Outstanding job by the Survios team. One of the best fighting games in VR. Great for honing overall boxing technique, movement etc...

I can't emphasize enough how fun this game is. From training to fighting, it's just a good time. Love the graphics, performance and realism. Definately one of my favorites - and I rarely ever play boxing games. Thanks!

review_title: Good, but short with poor locomotion
one_reviews_text:
Having a PVP multiplayer option turns this game into endless fun.   I've been able to find other players so far even during off peak hours so that's much better than most VR games.  Graphics are also very pretty as well. 

The campaign mode is too short but PVP with a decent player base makes up for that to me.  

The thing that really takes this game down from a 5 to a 3 is the extremely poor locomotion control.  You have to move with your hands while fighting with your hands all at the same time.   Extremely unnatural feeling and focus breaking.  I wish they would add a thumbstick control locomotion option.

Overall, I would still buy this game as the PVP makes it all worth it.

I have been waiting for a proper VR boxing game and this is definitely it! It feels so realistic and the opponents are intimidating, the only reason I gave it 4 stars is because the few PVP matches I have played round 2 always glitches and noone can move. This game is so fun, It would be cool to add some ring girls to the bigger rings perhaps. Thank you
They finally updated hit detection and this game feels amazing

Things that I'd love to see implemented:

-A shortcut to establish a new center position.
-An option to hide the arcade vissual effects.
-Make characters blink! Sly is specially spooky because of this.
-On training games, I'd like to see my score every time, even if I don't beat my record.
-Being on the Gym, free locomotion system is very good, but in-fight is very awkward, whay can't it be like when we walk in the gym?
-An option to do endless montage (with score count) so we can workout!
-it would be cool to manage the amazing OST from Montage, to choose which song we want to hear, also for the fights.

Thanks devs!

Wow, what a masterpiece!

Terribly simple game mechanic tuned to perfection! Great game design and love the fullbody avatar. The joint solver never makes a mistake, beautiful and organic deformations of the body.

But the highlight is the collision system implemented for fist fighting. Love the way they disconnect the hand effector and the motion controller to give you a feeling as if you hit a real object. Nr 1 fighting game in VR and defintely in the top 3 vr games for me.

Thrill of the fight is still the ultimate boxing game right now.
So far the 'career' is boring and arcadey. Special affects to let you know you've hit something(stars and streaks) slowmotion affect when you dodge an attack and your gloves will glow when you're out of stamina.
Yep, stamina. Instead of reling on your own physical stamina the game creates it for you. Restricting you through the fight, so your expected to wait for your avatar to catch up. Ridiculous mechanic.
The "advanced locomotion" mechanic is pathetic. Forcing you to wave your hands about in order to move forward.
I thought the PVP would be it's saving grace, no.
Bunch of arm flailing kids, super easy to just shell, wait for them to tire, then go to work.
I've walked through every single opponent. So no challenge there.
If you like the whole arcadey feel then jump right in, you'll love it.
But I personally love sweating my butt off and grinding away in a proper ring. So I'm heading over to ToTF, where the men are.

This game is good but im having a really tough time to get rocky balboa and im really tired of getting him and im even searching on internet explorer but its only available for psvr and its hard for oculus but i have walcott bowl but anyways good game.

Game is great. The best VR game in the store and the best I've played. The reason for 3 stars is due to poor tracking. Cpu gets right up in yourt face when fight, like 2cm from you face close. Some punches donm't connect due to this, while the cpu connects every punch even when you're blocking. The movement system is honestly garbage, you have to move with you hands while punching, dodging , and blocking. Besides all these cons the game is really great.

This is the ultimate game of 2018 and best Virtual Reality game EVER! Amazing! The PVP part is amazing, I had some great win with comebacks and all of that, really unpredictable fights which is amazing. A major stride in VR. 

The only negative thing about this game is that the Career/story mode is way to short. I would love if the story is longer and there are more opponents. I hope they make more for the career mode. Right now it feels short. However there is a lot of fun to be had in the PVP mode. 

Check out my channel and Creed video reviews where I will be posting tons of awesome Creed content - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Svqsdt94_p8

Thank you.
Great way to exercise and lots of fun.
1 star for recenter not working.
Amazing game. Great graphics,music and story. Absolutely a must have in every library.

my guard clipped through the opponent's fist because he keeps trying to occupy my space. This kncoked that boxer out. This along with many other ridiculous problems made me delete this game from my computer after the secodn day of playing it. It feels like most of what I do in the game doesn't count . It's very buggy to the point where I get teleported outside of play areas and  any movement makes me max tired immediately even just to walk a step forward.

review_title: Champion Difficulty is honestly a joke
one_reviews_text: I can beat every fighter on Pro difficulty in less than 3 minutes. Tried out Champion difficulty for a bigger challenge... it's not that it's more challenging, it's just BS. Fighting the security guard in the back alley, he can constantly put you down with one punch that magically slips past your guard, after defending the previous 25 and knocking him down twice. I hit him 40+ times after getting two knockdowns, and only getting knocked down once. He gets the remaining two knockdowns to beat me in THREE HITS. That I was guarding. This is the 6th or 7th time I've tried this fight and it always goes this way. Cool game but Champion mode needs some serious tweaking.

review_title: ALL CAP SO U CAN SEE CLEAR BEST VR GAME
one_reviews_text:
EVER.SO FAR

THIS GAME IS HANDS DOWN THE BEST VR /ANY  GAME IVE EVER PLAYED IN MY LIFE.PLEASE ADD MORE AND MORE CONTENT IAM BEGGING.AND IF U DONT BUY THIS GAME U DONT NEED VR GO PLAY SEGA.I FELT LIKE I WAS ACTUALLY IN THE RING TOE TO TOE WITH MY APPONENT .ALL THE WAY NO LIE IF U DONT THINK THE SAME HIT ME UP AND ILL GIVE U YOUR MONEY BACK AND THIS AINT EVEN MY GAME THATS HOW SERIOUS IAM ABOUT THE EMERGIN.THIS GAME WILL MAKE U  GET A RIFT AND ONLY PLAY THIS GAME THATS HOW EMERSIVE IT IS AND ID NEVER SAY THAT ABOUT A BOXING GAME .IAM TYPING THIS NOW SWEATING BULLITS FROW 3 TRAINNINGS AND 3 FIGHTS LOVE THIS S**TTT AND IT WILL ALSO HELP YOUR SPAWING OUT IN REAL LIFE LIKE BEING TRAINED BY ROCKEY THIS IS LIKE A ILL TEACH YOU TO FIGHT IN THE REAL WORLD LIKE A PRO IN A VR GAME. THAZTS WHAT IT DOES BET YOUR MONEY LOVE IT PLEASE KEEP IT UP AND DEVS THATKS AND I DONT EVEN REALLY LIKE BOXING GAMES NOW IAM TURNOUT AND IVE PLAYED THEM ALL NOTHING IS LIKE THIS PLS...........................BUY THIS ***ING GAME SO I CAN BEAT YOUR *** ONLINE....10 OUT OF 10 IF THEY ADD MORE CONTENT 20/20      PS RestlessDreams inc.
I bought the game but it won't open, I tried restarting my pc, oculus, and uninstalled then reinstalled but it still won't open
review_feedback: Hey toby4098, Apologies for the launching issues you're having with Creed. Would you mind contacting us at support@survios.com so we can troubleshoot this issue with you? Thank you for your patience!

one_reviews_text:
This a great game, and really does work well to aid weight loss, after about 10mins ill be sweating and my heart rate up 140-150bpm. i mainly use this game for sparring and in gym exersises it really is spot on for that however it would of been nice if the pad trainer was calling out combos rather than just numbering the pads. 
The career mode is well to short and tracking can be iffy which is thrustraing.
but definatly worth a buy just for the training its a fun way to loose weight.
Very good experience and good exercise.  Exhausted going through a couple fights want to try pvp, but waited for a little while and didnt have any joiners.
A "stamina" mechanic in VR boxing game is ridiculus and frustrating

pros:
-smooth alternating hand gesture to walk feels good and is not nearly as nauseating you might think.
-extremely satisfying punches even without hitting a physical target
-excellent gameplay, smooth with few bugs in everything but pvp.
- a full season on medium difficulty is an excellent every day workout, takes about an hour maybe less if you rush it.
cons:
-multiplayer needs some tuning, theres weird short punches that can have the same strength as a windup, this needs to change.
-no indication of latency with sparring partner in pvp
-different movement controls in the ring compared to the gym, !?why?!
-prepare to sweat excessively
-most destructive game ive played because if u catch oculus cable with your arm that thing is goin full send, my advice is to harness part of your cable so it doesnt shake your slots in card at the least.


overall i still suggest you get it, lots of fun for anybody.

I gave this a try today. I love Thrill of the Fight and as a HUGE prize fighting and Rocky fan, I can tell you that I almost had a tear in my eye as soon as it started. Goose bumps and chills for sure. This IS what VR is to me. UN-FREAKING-BELIEVABLE!

I heard the graphics were good but didn't expect to be this blown away. Atmosphere, sound, mechanics, gameplay, story, training...it's all there!

Going toe to toe online and in VR ! This has been a game that I have wanted someone to make for a very long time and am so happy to finally see it come to pass.

 I have read a ton about the stamina feature, and for Career mode it makes no sense. They could easily make the boxers exhibit thier own individual levels of stamina via how many punches they can throw before needing to cover up. Online however is a different story. The reason for that is players can use smaller quicker shots like rolls they would do to a speed bag, and because that takes very little energy i'm sure they put in the stamina as a safety net. Until they fix the ability to land shots that do damage using small swings they need to leave that feature turned on for online play. One thing they could do however is at least double the amount of shots needed to tire you out so that you can land some longer combos  and maybe score some faster knockouts. I have played 6 rounds so far online and am 5 and 1 the one time I lost was with a guy using the short punch method. The next two matches I had it figured out and didnt change the way I boxed and was able to beat him fairly easy, but it should still be fixed :)

 Unfortunately I have one other major gripe and its about the gameplay itself in terms of the rounds and how they play out. It is EXTREMELY arcadish here. If you knock someone down or are knocked down it automatically ends the round. It should continue with the said boxer needing to recover and should certainly go to round end, with the 3 knockdown rule in affect. 

 Even with the issues I have with the game it is by far the most fun I've had online in a long time. If they fix these bugs and gameplay issues I would give it 5 stars and could easily see this being a League game. I'd be the most in shape 48 year old I know...lol

What a great game.  Controls are very responsive and the game as a whole looks fantastic. I am very happy with this purchase, its what VR needed. My only negative is there should be a mode to turn off certain features to make an even more realistic in PVP if wanted . Now so much with the review. I am calling out MRTV and Sweviver as well as Chris Ronda, I am going to destroy all of you in the ring. C.O. B rules.

I grew up watching the Rocky movies, and so playing this game was definitely going to bring back some memories for me!! At first I was a bit apprehensive about buying it because people were saying the campaign is quite short, but I sitll think it's worth every penny!!! The mechanics and responsiveness of the game is great. Runs perfect even on a GTX 970 and the game is just so well executed.

The only gripe I would have is there not being more elements to the story, not enough narrative. But the music, atmosphere and everything else can really bring you into the game and grab you, especially if you were a fan of Rocky before.

With all that being said, I'm giving this game a 4 out of 5, simply because of the length of the campaign. If it were even an hour longer, I would have given it a 5.

It feels super polished, a few moments where the opponents is punching and it doesn't matter how well your super strong punch lands it just doesn't matter, they have some sort of "invincibility frames". But other than that it feels really good.

The campaign consists of "Black screen that says X months before/after X fight" -> Go train to get better stamina for fight -> Fight dude -> Rinse and repeat. And it takes like an hour to beat.

I hope they add more FREE DLC, non of that payed stuff.

After the campaign there is free play and the training exercises and PvP.

I can't help but feel like the tech demo feeling like so many other VR games, REALLY looking forward to the day that more VR games have a campaign that's at least 5 hours, 10 hours would be better.

Apparently, the game crashed due to some weird interaction with UE4. I was able to make it work by fully uninstalling UE4, reinstalling Creed, and reinstalling UE4 again. 

Now that I was able to actually play the game, I can say that this is truly a VR masterpiece. It's arguably the best VR Boxing game in the market. The mechanics "feel" quite real and it doesn't suffer, as most VR Boxing games do, from any kind of hit detection problem. The graphics are probably the best I have seen in VR so far, and it runs very smoothly with my setup (GTX 1070).

Congratulations on a beautiful game!

--- Old Comment ----

The game doesn't even start. It crashes seconds after pressing "Play" with a "Unreal Engine 4 Crash Reporter" window.
review_feedback: Hey Survivor91, Apologies for this crashing issue you're experiencing with the game. Would you mind contacting us at support@survios.com with your DxDiag attached? We'd be more than happy to help troubleshoot this crashing issues with you!

one_reviews_text: Pure means of fun. Reminds me of PS3 Move action game The Fight! which was a blast! VR really makes it even more :D... and still better way to do cardio after hours than ordinary stationary stuff :D. Excellent music. I Recommend.

People saying this is the best VR game, need to try more games!  There are good bits and bad bits about this game.  I got it the day it was released and first impressions weren't good, the menu was behind me to start with, Creeds legs are bandy and makes me wonder why they even put them in, it looks stupid and he is constantly stepping on his own feet.  The training is quite good, mainly due to the Rocky montage music, the fights are okay but I personally think they could have done a lot better.  This game will exhaust you, so that's good! Prepare to sweat! lol  Still worth getting even though it's not perfect.

review_title: No option to reset camera view.
one_reviews_text:
I was having issues with the camera always being 180 degrees behind me and no option to reset it in game, but was able to fix it with the help of the support team.  I re-set up my colus play space and now Creed reflects my actual sensor positions.  Thanks support team!

As for the game, it's fun!  I really enjoy the boxing aspect of it with two exceptions.  The method of walking forward (or backward) is a bit ridiculous.  Having to power walk swing your arms in order to move a few feet is annoying.  Why can't we just use one of the two joysticks??  The unfortunate thing is the developer has doubled down on this mechanic in order to get up after you have been knocked down.  I truly wish this "feature" was replaced with something else.  I prefer the "balance" meter type of mechanic from the later Fight Night games (or something similar) instead of bushwacking my arms like a fool when i am trying to get back up. With its current implementation, I can never get up more than two times at any point during a fight.  

That said, actual punching and blocking feels great.  Some more physical damage on the opponents face (and perhaps my vision) would be a cool addition, but I understand you can't have it all.  Overall a good game with potential to be even better.
review_feedback: Hey twistedpixel_marshal, would you mind contacting us at support@survios.com so we can help troubleshoot this issue with you?

one_reviews_text:
Great game. Feels fairly realistic. Helps if you actually stand up and throw punches (watch your play space, I went through the guardian wall with a punch when chasing an opponent--bye bye lamp). There's potential for cheating by waving the controllers in short shakes instead of actual punching, which kind of defeats the object. Worst thing? The artificial stamina. Creed should be in better condition than me, not worse. All in all, great fun and a good workout but could do with a few tweaks to force actual punching (relevant most for PVP and rankings in the training games) and give an option to remove the stamina.

UPDATE: Finished the all-too-easy career mode but then there's PVP which is worth the price of the game. Great fun and much more of a challenge. Negatives remain the same and I'll add that I find the movement mechanic really glitchy in the ring, though it's fine in the gym area. Overall though, the negatives are outweighed by the positives. Consider my review a 4.5. Look forward to seeing you in the ring.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_OKDrdFNiWY (PLEASE NOTE: Links from Oculus do not work at the moment so search YouTube for 'Paradise Decay VR Creed: Rise To Glory'

My Thoughts:
Another SUPERB Survios game!
These guys are rocking it in VR.
Trained by Rocky Balboa you play the legendary boxer Creed.

This game does a great job of implementing 360 room-scale tracking that allows real boxing moves while eliminating the cheese factor. Users can't use a "height trick" to burrow in to the ground or trick the tracking sensors with various head/wrist combinations that make the game believe punches are happening. You have to work hard for both offense and defense in the game. Real strategy takes center stage. You better invest in a big ol fan to keep you cool during back-to-back fighting!

The game is in my humble opinion greatly executed and A LOT of fun to play! 
It's just not one of those "punch the fastest and see who wins" game (except for online, kinda... we'll get to that in a second), but rather that you got to play strategically and plan your moves, blocks and dodges etc. Simply genius!        
And it feels very realistic! I love the idea of running out of stamina after a while, sure it's not the most realistic-working feature but that's impossible to do something about, I love how they solved it. 
About the online thing I mentioned. The thing is people just throw punches until the get tired which kinda sucks IMO (basically rolling their hands when fighting). That should be fixed so that it's a very ineffective way to fight, altough not a problem against AI. It also feels very arcade-y, which makes it less serious. Just something to maybe keep in mind.
My only REAL gripe with the game is that it is very short. Got a little over an hour of gameplay. I was totally enjoying myself until the credits came up and almost made me cry. A big problem in the VR-genre, sadly. That's why it got 4 stars instead of 5 stars. 

Conclusion: I strongly recommend you buying it if you like moving and are not afraid to sweat!

review_title: Great Game and getting me in shape
one_reviews_text: I will be short and sweet.  I LOVE this game.  Once of the better VR experiences I've had. I will say though that if you are not in shape, this game can be brutal.  When I got knocked out the second time, I actually had to lay on the floor because I was so tired.  The next day, my body was sore in all sorts of places. Had to lay off the game for about 3 days.  2nd time playing, it wasn't so brutal. I was tired at the end of the session but not as sore.  Only issue is playing online doesn't feel as fun as the story mode.  The other guys seem to be flailing and knocking me out even when I'm blocking but that doesn't ruin the game for me.  I didn't get the game for multiplayer, I wanted the game to see if it could help me get back into shape.  Seems to be helping out with my stamina but I won't really know until many more sessions.  GREAT GAME

review_title: Very good impression in first 15 minutes
one_reviews_text:
Fantastic smooth play which does not require the whole  room. Great graphics and theme, and excellent hit detection for the most part (I noticed once or twice that the swing just kind of froze or went through the opponent).

This is what a boxing game should be, pretty to look at, fun and has the option for room scale or standing.

There is no sound when trying to play the game through BT headphones on a rift. All settings are set to output to headphones but it still does not work. I don't know what else I can do. I can't refund either.

Well this is one occasion I can use the phrase "literally unplayable" literally :D
review_feedback: Hey TheWonderSwan, apologies for this audio issue you're experiencing with your BT headphones. Please contact us at support@survios.com and we'd be more than happy to help troubleshoot this with you!

review_title: I'm out of shape and this game knows it!
one_reviews_text:
I don't give every game five stars but this game is great so far. I haven't sweat  this much since I did a P90X workout! Unfortunately that was years ago :(

I want to keep playing career a bit before PVP (so happy there is a PVP mode it BTW). Though, I need to take a quick break. VR is so awesome with quality games like this!

Overall, a great game. Not too hard, not too easy and very entertaining. One of my favourite thing about this game is that you don't have to swing your arm at the enemy, all you have to do is punch. You can choose the way you fight and I love the slow mo part and when you can punch him several times before a knockout. I love games that bring me to sweating which makes it even more awesome. I have one negative aspect, though. I don't like the stamina bar. The player gets out of power. Instead you guys should raise the health of the enemies and remove the stamina effect. Though, definitely one of my favourites!
downloaded yesterday cracking game good workout game play brilliant. is there free locomotion that would make it stunning

review_title: not Spanish and things to correct
one_reviews_text:
Every game should be doubled to the most spoken and spoken language in the world, Spanish.

I do not like the way to move moving your hands. It is more comfortable to use the pad. In online matches, you see your opponent making ridiculous movements with his hands when using this form of movement. It does not look like a real fight

The movement of the feet is not real either. Sometimes you look like a rag doll.

The hands always remain open in combat. They should be closed by pressing the touch triggers.

This is a really fun game.  I wouldn't say it's better than Thrill of the Fight, but it has multiplayer.  It feels like a cross between Thrill of the Fight and arcade style, but it works great.  Well worth the asking price.  Make sure you have a decent amount of room to play this game.  I have roomscale on Rift but I turn that option off in this game so I can use the sticks to snap turn.

Deserves every star ! This is an awesome game ! Great job Servios ! PVP player animations can get a little wonky - but thats par for the course in VR right now. DEVS; WE NEED A LEADER BOARD OR SOME WAY TO SEE OUR WIN/LOSS RECORD ! PLEASE ! Love the game ! GREAT Cardio work out !

What a fun Game! Runs smoothly like butter. I often have the moment, like: "Stand up! You want a few more in your face?!" while I'm sweating and completely out of breath xD Its better then fitness. And Rocky is there too :D

this is the best boxing game i have ever played.the music pumps you up when you train and the campaign is amazing!! you can play with your friends or with others in pvp modes.deffenitly i would recomend this as one of the best,.
I LOVE ROCKY!!!!1
Amazing,  the graphisme are such incredible and the PVP is realy cool
Very nicely made, and performs very well; although there is a lack of graphics settings it's still a lovely game to play. The actual combat is lovely and the arcade aspect makes it fun

review_title: I felt like I was boxing.
one_reviews_text: I have never written a review before... But this game was mind blowing everything felt smooth and I felt like I was boxing. The game was responding to my movement just fine including dodging. I see myself playing this quite often and even using it as a party attraction.
Love this game!

Another homerun for Survios! The music and graphics are great. The ring feels more alive unlike knockout league. For me, the controls are easy to understand. I didn't have any problems. Fun, arcade style boxing. I recommend this one.

Rly Great Game i like the Multiplayer and also the Training Ranking  List. While I am active in 0Thai Boxing and Boxing this is a Great Training. Follow me on Twitch to see more Content of this Great game https://www.twitch.tv/th_hutch/

review_title: Game of the future for instant home gym
one_reviews_text: If the devs can turn off the exhausting arm rest function thing then it's a real approach in simulating a high intense boxing experience, without the negative effects of getting your head punched in.
The game its self is good, i do wish you controlled your stamina but thats all game logical. If they added like 5 more fights then ill give it a 5 star, but overall really good
Worth the cash!!! In future updates it would be great if you could allow for more than two players to just hang around the gym and be social while we hit the speed bag or something.

one_reviews_text: Amazing game, great graphics, but its a short game and I  haven't seen anyone online for the PVP. Worth getting though.

one_reviews_text: Played career mode for 30 minutes, very sweaty and smiling!=) Best boxing sim ive tried so far!
